Comments.Message:
I am sure the team is perfectly capable of resolving this issue on their own; however, I don't like opening or voting on issues without offering more than just "I agree" or "This is broken."

Thus: http://www.silverlightshow.net/tips/Tip-How-to-capture-mouse-scroll-wheel-event-in-Silverlight.aspx - explains how to capture mouse scroll wheel events in Silverlight apps.

@Binary: The problem isn't that we aren't handling it there, it's that Safari doesn't work with Silverlight's handling of the MouseWheel. This is systemic across Silverlight applications and adding that point doesn't help (according to reports).

That said, if what I just did to the Item dropdown DOES work when you see the new Rawr3 posted, let us know and I'll see if I can make that work for the main charts as well.
